Homicide.origin: [Latin homicidium , from homo human being + caedere to cut, kill]

2.definition: the killing of one human being by another compare,

criminal homicide.definition: homicide committed by a person with a criminal state of mind (as intentionally, with premeditation, knowingly, recklessly, or with criminal negligence)

deliberate homicide.definition: homicide caused purposely and knowingly used in Montana

excusable homicide.definition: homicide that is committed by accident or misfortune by a person doing a lawful act by lawful means with usual and ordinary caution and without any unlawful intent and that is excused under the law with no criminal punishment imposedin this entry

homicide by misadventure.definition: homicide that occurs as the result of an accident caused by a person doing a lawful act with no unlawful intent

justifiable homicide.definition: homicide that is committed in self-defense, in defense of another and esp. a member of one's family or sometimes in defense of a residence, in preventing a felony esp. involving great bodily harm, or in performing a legal duty and that is justified under the law with no criminal punishment imposedin this entry

negligent homicide.definition: homicide caused by a person's criminally negligent act

reckless homicide.definition: homicide caused by a person's reckless acts
reckless homicide.note: In Illinois, involuntary manslaughter committed by use of a motor vehicle is called reckless homicide.

ve·hic·u·lar homicide.definition: [vē-hi-kyə-lər-]homicide committed by the use of a vehicle (as an automobile or boat)
